name: MonsterBattle Cards
description:
Monster Battle Cards

Get ready for epic battles against fearsome enemies in Monster Battle Cards! Assemble your deck and choose your cards carefully, because you'll need to use them strategically to defeat your opponents. Each card has unique abilities, such as dealing damage, providing extra lives and coins, and more. But watch out, because the enemy will also damage you. With every kill, you'll earn coins that you can use to buy more cards. Will you emerge victorious in the ultimate card battle? Play Monster Battle Cards and find out!

Controls

The entire game can be played using the mouse/touch, no other hardware input needed. 

Types of cards Battle Card - Play them wisely to damage your enemy Rivet Card - Doesn‘t make any damage but still cost you(Definetly not a bug I wasn‘t able to fix until now :) ) Shield Card - Powers up you shield to block more damage Heart Card - Need some extra health? They give you a little health boost Coin Card - Need some extra money for new plays? They give you some coins back  Idea

The game was created for the Jame Gam #26. The given special object was "Cards" so I had the idea to program a card game, here the given theme "You are the monster" was important. Instead of having a hero fight a monster as usual, I decided to reverse the roles. You fight with monsters against heroes. Since the whole thing had to be realised in only 5 days, I put less priority on animations than on a variety of features and design (animations will definitely come in the future). For the game engine I chose Unit because I had already done one or the other tutorial project in it before.

Stats I spend around 45h on developing the game itself and also around 2h to make the game concept. Credits Without the following users/sites/tools the project wouldn‘t be possible to finish in time:

  • CafeDraw(Card Design), analogStudios_(Enemy & Monster sprites) on itch.io - For the game assets
  • Tiny Worlds on Unity Assets Store - For the pixelart font
  • ChatGPT  - For the help of making the base game concept & helping with problems
  • Midjourney - For the logo design

Also thanks to all beta testers from my discord community for helping me to find & fix bugs, and all other people that contributed to the project(For playing and sharing the game)
